pageContext.claim: “All of these countries, including the European Union, they charge five times the tariff. We don't charge tariffs, essentially. They charge five times what we charge for tariffs.”
pageContext.analysis: The United States imposes tariffs on half of all industrial goods, at a trade-weighted average import rate of 2 percent, according to the Office of the U.S. Trade Representative. Tariff rates vary by product, with some of the highest imposed on clothing and apparel. U.S. import duties totaled $33.1 billion in 2017, according to the U.S. International Trade Commission.
